Result.description: Base class of all result types

template.description: Name of the template used to render the result

title.description: Link title of the result item

content.description: Extract or description of the result item

img_src.description: URL of a image that is displayed in the result item

iframe_src.description: URL of an embedded `<iframe>` / the frame is collapsible

thumbnail.description: URL of a thumbnail that is displayed in the result item

publishedDate.description: The date on which the object was published

pubdate.description: String representation of `MainResult.publishedDate`. Deprecated: it is still partially used in the templates, but will one day be completely eliminated.

views.description: View count in humanized number format

priority.description: The priority can be set via :ref:`hostnames plugin`, for example

engines.description: In a merged results list, the names of the engines that found this result are listed in this field

MainResult.description: Base class of all result types displayed in area main results

LegacyResult.description: A wrapper around a legacy result item. The SearXNG core uses this class for untyped dictionaries / to be downward compatible. This class is needed until we have implemented an `Result` class for each result type and the old usages in the codebase have been fully migrated.

schema.description: The search query. This string is passed to external search services. Thus, SearXNG supports syntax of each search service. For example, site:github.com SearXNG is a valid query for Google. However, if simply the query above is passed to any search engine which does not filter its results based on this syntax, you might not get the results you wanted.

parameters.description: The search query. This string is passed to external search services. Thus, SearXNG supports syntax of each search service. For example, site:github.com SearXNG is a valid query for Google. However, if simply the query above is passed to any search engine which does not filter its results based on this syntax, you might not get the results you wanted.
parameters.name: q

schema.description: Comma separated list, specifies the active search categories

parameters.description: Comma separated list, specifies the active search categories
parameters.name: categories

schema.description: Comma separated list, specifies the active search engines

parameters.description: Comma separated list, specifies the active search engines
parameters.name: engines

schema.description: Time range of search for engines which support it

parameters.description: Time range of search for engines which support it
parameters.name: time_range

schema.description: Open search results on new tab

parameters.description: Open search results on new tab
parameters.name: results_on_new_tab

schema.description: Open search results on new tab

parameters.description: Open search results on new tab
parameters.name: image_proxy

schema.description: Service which completes words as you type

parameters.description: Service which completes words as you type
parameters.name: autocomplete

schema.description: Open search results on new tab

parameters.description: Open search results on new tab
parameters.name: safesearch

200.description: Return results in the requested format.

number_of_results.description: Average number of results reported by engines

results.description: List of search results (typed or legacy)

items.description: A wrapper around a legacy result item. The SearXNG core uses this class for untyped dictionaries / to be downward compatible. This class is needed until we have implemented an `Result` class for each result type and the old usages in the codebase have been fully migrated.
